botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause severe discomfort if ingested and contact with the sap may irritate the skin or eyes. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Philodendron can be shrubs, trees or climbers, with glossy, leathery, evergreen, simple to pinnately divided leaves, and tiny flowers borne within arum-like white, green or reddish spathes

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow under glass in a loam-based potting compost in bright filtered light with shade from hot sun, mist daily. When in growth water moderately and apply a balanced liquid fertiliser monthly. Water sparingly at other times
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed surface sown at 19 to 24 °C or layer in spring
how_to_grow.pruning: No regular pruning is required, but thin out if overcrowded or getting too large, and remove dead or yellowing leaves
how_to_grow.pests: May be attacked by scale insects, mealybugs and glasshouse red spider mite
